strings.catalogueWaterDescription: The IFRC and its member national societies have built a network of WASH expertise and equipment to respond to a range of disaster scale and context. On average, we provide 1.8 million people per year with access to safe water, sanitation and hygiene promotion in emergency response globally.
strings.technicalFrameworkDetail: Tiered competencies describing the knowledge and skills expected of personnel in this sector.
strings.technicalEquipmentOneDetail: Water treatment at household level for 2,000 people.
strings.technicalEquipmentM15Detail: Water treatment and distribution for 15,000 people.
strings.technicalERUM20Detail: Sanitation facilities and hygiene promotion for 20,000 people.
strings.technicalERUM40Detail: Water treatment and distribution for 40,000 people.
strings.technicalWaterSupplyDetail: Rapidly assess the state of the existing water system and improve the system.
strings.technicalWaterTreatmentDetail: Design and implement a comprehensive household water program.
strings.technicalEquipmentWaterTreatmentLink: Household Water Treatment and Safe Storage (HWTS)
strings.technicalWaterSludgeDetail: Empty, transport and treat 20 mÂ³ of design Faecal Sludge from on-site containments
strings.additionWashPortalDetail: This is an online resource and toolbox for WASH practitioners.
